intro: Tauschia nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's tauschia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ornamental species in horticulture.
